div1.p:
You were kind to answer my request for information. The paper on which I was working was not a thesis for a degree (Northwestern will not permit a thesis any more) but was a statement of epic development in America, with particular emphasis upon your work. I was successful in convincing the members — and faculty — of my seminar that you rather than Benét, Jeffers, Robinson, Eliot, Pound, Hovey, Moody, represent epic as it must be. The several poets were fired at me by various people, each of whom had a theory. There are moments, sir, when I am mightily in-clined to shout about other values in literature and living which seem to elude the precious analyses of Waldo Frank, the Chicago Remaissance, regionalism, and the like. It seems, of late, that people insist upon attitudes in every blessed effort they make. I prefer to climb when I
11b
can afford it.

If you'll permit, I want to give you a bit of my background, and then ask another question:
I am a graduate of Wesleyan University and have been fortunate enough to study under Fred Millet, Alex Courie, and Wilbert Snow, who was my tutor — I've been attending Northwestern University evenings for several years working on my MA, and meeting requirements for teaching in Illinois. At present I am assistant headmaster and practically all the English Department at The Chicago Latin School for Boys. As an under-graduate I did my distinction study on Francis Thompson; and again was fortunate, because Father Connolly of Boston College, turned me loose in their Thompson room whenever I made the trip to Boston. On the strength of this rather sketchy background, I want to ask your permission to do my doctoral work on John G. Neihardt. I don't know specifics as yet because I haven't thought enough on it; and I can't begin until a year from September. But I have
11c
read everything of yours that I can find in New and Northwestern, and I know that I want to undertake the work when I may. Perhaps you would prefer that I do other work —— I know that our trustees expect me to take a doctorate in Education if I ever hope to become head of the school. My wife would never forgive me if I gave in to them. I rather expect it will be easy to arrange my leave of absence when the time comes! One Mark Neville is enough.

Thanks again for your kindness. Could you tell me if Macmillan has any copies of the one-volume "A Cycle of the West"? (I believe that the only books available in Chicago right now are by either Motley or Spillane).

closer.salute: A most happy Easter to you,
